title: Matt Renshaw seeks Matthew Hayden’s tips to tackle Indian spinners | cricket | Hindustan Times
text:
Desimartini Matt Renshaw seeks Matthew Hayden’s tips to tackle Indian spinners 
Australia cricket team players have been bracing for the spin test they will be facing from Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja when they take on Virat Kohli-led India cricket team in the Test series. cricket Updated: Feb 09, 2017 19:13 IST IANS Dubai Young Australia cricket team's Matt Renshaw scored a century in the Test series against Pakistan and is expected to perform well in sub-continent conditions during the series vs India cricket team starting this month end. (REUTERS) 
Australian cricketers are leaving no stones unturned in their preparations for the four-Test series later this month against India, with rookie opening batsman Matt Renshaw seeking advice from legendary opener Matthew Hayden to tackle the deadly spin duo of Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja. 
The 20-year-old Renshaw said Hayden had tipped him to enjoy and gather as much experience of playing in the sub-continent conditions, which could help him in future tours. 
“I had a couple of conversations with him (Hayden) over the phone and he’s really good. He has just told me to embrace it over there and get as much experience as I can,” Matt was quoted as saying by espncricinfo. 
Read more | Monty Panesar says Aussie batsman Matt Renshaw can stop Virat Kohli’s spinners 
“I’m 20 years old and going over to play in one of the hardest places in the world. So I will just try to embrace it and enjoy the challenge.” 
“You hear certain things from certain players but you never know until you get over there. So looking forward to the challenge,” he added. 
The Australia cricket team is currently undergoing a training camp here to acclimatise and prepare for the upcoming India tour, with the first Test to be played in Pune from February 23. tags
